first_reading.text:
[[Rm 3,21]]Brothers and sisters, now the righteousness of God has been manifested apart from the law, though testified to by the law and the prophets,
[[Rm 3,22]]the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ for all who believe. For there is no distinction;
[[Rm 3,23]]all have sinned and are deprived of the glory of God.
[[Rm 3,24]]They are justified freely by his grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus,
[[Rm 3,25]]whom God set forth as an expiation, through faith, by his blood, to prove his righteousness because of the forgiveness of sins previously committed,
[[Rm 3,26]]through the forbearance of God--to prove his righteousness in the present time, that he might be righteous and justify the one who has faith in Jesus.
[[Rm 3,27]]What occasion is there then for boasting? It is ruled out. On what principle, that of works? No, rather on the principle of faith.
[[Rm 3,28]]For we consider that a person is justified by faith apart from works of the law.
[[Rm 3,29]]Does God belong to Jews alone? Does he not belong to Gentiles, too? Yes, also to Gentiles,
[[Rm 3,30]]for God is one and will justify the circumcised on the basis of faith and the uncircumcised through faith.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans

psalm.text:
[[Ps 130,1]]Out of the depths I cry to you, O LORD
[[Ps 130,2]]LORD, hear my voice!
Let your ears be attentive
to my voice in supplication.

[[Ps 130,3]]If you, O LORD, mark iniquities,
LORD, who can stand?
[[Ps 130,4b]]But with you is forgiveness,
[[Ps 130,4c]]that you may be revered.

[[Ps 130,5]]I trust in the LORD;
my soul trusts in his word.
[[Ps 130,6]]My soul waits for the Lord 
more than sentinels for dawn.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,47]]The Lord said: â€œWoe to you! You build the memorials of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
[[Lc 11,48]]Consequently, you bear witness and give consent to the deeds of your ancestors, for they killed them and you do the building.
[[Lc 11,49]]Therefore, the wisdom of God said, 'I will send to them prophets and apostles; some of them they will kill and persecute'
[[Lc 11,50]]in order that this generation might be charged with the blood of all the prophets shed since the foundation of the world,
[[Lc 11,51]]from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah who died between the altar and the temple building. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be charged with their blood!
[[Lc 11,52]]Woe to you, scholars of the law! You have taken away the key of knowledge. You yourselves did not enter and you stopped those trying to enter."
[[Lc 11,53]]When he left, the scribes and Pharisees began to act with hostility toward him and to interrogate him about many things,
[[Lc 11,54]]for they were plotting to catch him at something he might say.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
